modules.description: Provides functions to create, open, and manage POSIX semaphores, including waiting, posting, and removing them. Operates on semaphore identifiers and named semaphores using platform-specific system calls. Used to synchronize processes in multi-threaded or distributed applications requiring atomic operations.

The functions enable managing POSIX semaphores through operations like creating, waiting, posting, and synchronization, handling both named and unnamed semaphores. They facilitate inter-process communication and resource coordination, with error handling via Result.t or Unix_error exceptions. Use cases include synchronizing access to shared resources across processes or managing concurrent operations in distributed systems.
